Smart software for creative people

Foundry is not just a technology maker or a software seller; we are here to empower artists and designers across the world by enhancing their creative potential. We seek to create a world where people can continually raise their creative potential and to champion creative people by developing tools, technologies and processes that empower them to bring their ideas to life, more quickly and effectively.

 

We believe in:

 

  • Constantly challenging
  • Always being approachable
  • Committed partners
  • Endless enthusiasm!

 

Our technology portfolio is as creative as it is technical, packed full of ground-breaking, award-winning techy goodness that will have even the most demanding organization salivating!


We are a little bit proud of what we achieve at The Foundry and want to take you on our journey with us.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
The Role and Responsibilities

We are seeking a skilled, versatile and highly professional software engineer to join the Katana team in either our London or Manchester offices.

Reporting to the Lead Katana Engineer, your standard daily work will involve the design, implementation and testing of C++ and/or Python code. You will also engage in bug-fixing as required, liaising with other Engineers on the team and the Product Manager to ensure that the code meets the requirements specified. You are likely to contribute to every part of the codebase as part of your job.

You will be responsible for the solving and timely delivery of your assigned tasks. You will work on the Katana product, implementing new features as well as supporting technical requests from clients, and any fixing bugs which are identified. You are responsible for identifying weaknesses in working practices and ensuring any defined processes and standards are followed.

You will work closely with the Katana Lead Engineer and the other Software and QA Engineers on the team. You may also be asked to liaise with clients, and with other Foundry teams including QA, Support and Sales.

It is amongst your responsibilities to understand Foundry’s business and the wider industry. You are encouraged to play an active role in communicating with and visiting customers, understanding and sharing requirements and proposed solutions.

title: Software Engineer

companyphilosophy:
Why Choose Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Lab (APL)?

We are not a place that seeks or enjoys the mundane or the rote. We are a place that prototypes, not one that manufactures in bulk. A place that innovates, not one that just copies and pastes. We look to apply our expertise in novel ways for the nation, and whether you are a recent grad or an experienced professional, you can make critical contributions to critical challenges for our nation at APL.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL), a national leader in scientific research and development, located midway between Baltimore and Washington, DC is seeking a Software Engineer for the Ocean Systems and Engineering (KMT) Group in the Force Projection Department.

Job Summary: Apply software engineering expertise to support data fusion and unmanned vehicle software development.

Duties:

  1. Develop application level software for data fusion and unmanned vehicle systems, to include detailed design, software development, laboratory testing, and field testing. (90%)
  2. Document software development activities and test results, prepare technical reports, present results, and demonstrate system capabilities to peer review groups, partners, working groups and sponsors. (10%)

Note: This job summary and listing of duties is for the purpose of describing the position and its essential functions at time of hire and may change over time.

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: E-Commerce, Home Furnishings, Platforms, Private
companyphilosophy:
The strength of the team is each member, the strength of each member is the TEAM!

Phil Jackson's quote, "the strength of the team is each member, the strength of each member is the team" really rings true for our group! We work together collaboratively to accomplish challenging, innovative and state-of-the-art solutions for our customers in the Home Furnishings industry. 

Over 80% of all furniture shoppers today are going online to decide which one or two stores they will visit to make their purchase.  Retailer websites and online showrooms have become the essential new “corner” locations. With MicroD’s deep industry experience and technical expertise, we've built OmniVue & eMRG – next generation online presentation and business intelligence platforms. This start-of-the-art solution unifies retailers, brands, and consumers to redefine the furniture buying and selling process. OmniVue3D delivers a powerfully realistic and interactive experience. This new 3D solution enables shoppers to better visualize furniture selections and seamlessly merge digital products into real physical spaces. With OmniVue platform, furniture retailers can choose from hundreds of manufacturer catalogs and display countless products on their websites. With ePiphany's eCommerce platform, customers can browse and buy products using the website. With OmniPlanner platform, customers can browse for furniture items and build a room.

At MicroD, you will be able to work on these extensive projects where you will be bringing next generation ideas and solutions forward to meet our customers' needs!
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
MicroD is seeking an experienced Software Architect with a Degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience with passion for changing the world with their contributions. You must have strong software engineering experience developing Wed-based solutions using C# and ASP.NET. At MicroD you will work with equally talented architects and software engineers to architect and implement eCommerce websites. This is a full-time position located in our corporate headquarters in beautiful Charlotte, North Carolina.

Applicants must have experience leading a software development team building Web-based applications, ideally using Microsoft IIS servers and Visual Studio C#. You must be drug-free and authorized to work in the US. Relocation assistance is offered.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 8+ years of professional software development experience
  • Technical team supervisor experience
  • Solid knowledge of advanced computer science principals
  • Strong software engineering experience developing Web-based solutions using C# and ASP.NET
  • Experience working with Microsoft SQL Server and IIS to design and implement high-performance, high-volume web applications in a multi-server environment.
  • Current experience working with cloud-based hosting environment
  • Team player with enthusiasm, bright ideas, and a strong desire to learn new skills

title: Software Architect - .NET & C#

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Software Development / Engineering, Founded 2008
companyphilosophy:
Why Work at AssureSign?

Our Product

AssureSign has been providing mission-critical electronic signature solutions to enterprise customers since 1999.  With over 180 million global signature events to-date, AssureSign is a clear leader in the market in both cloud and on-premise deployments.

Our Team

We’re customer centric and are committed to continuous improvements to stand out from the competition.  The backlog never gets smaller, but the product continues to evolve and improve.

We’re team players - We’re committed to the growth of our company and product and are supportive of one another.  We’re looking for a motivated developer to join us who thrives in a fast pace environment. 

We’re passionate about what we do, and have an ‘all hands on deck’ mentality when it comes to the success of our company and product.  We adapt, we find solutions, and are willing to question assumptions and think outside the box. We are looking for someone who shares those characteristics and is truly passionate about coding.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Javascript/C# Software Developer

Job Description

Growing software company looking for a self-starting, experienced, and versatile software developer based in Atlanta, GA or remote.

This skilled developer will work primarily out of our main office in the Atlanta Tech Village as an addition to our software team.

This team meets (virtually) and is responsible for rolling out regular releases to several web, mobile, and desktop applications.  At a high level, this developer will be responsible for:

  • designing and implementing new features and functionality for both new and existing web, mobile, and desktop applications
  • conducting R&D with new libraries, frameworks, and technologies
  • reviewing code
  • fixing bugs (nobody likes it, but we’ve all got to do it)
  • contributing to product documentation
  • responding to more technical questions from customers than we care to
  • communicating openly and effectively with co-workers and customers

We utilize agile methodologies and typically follow a 2-week release cadence. In addition to our daily scrum meetings via Skype, we also meet weekly (virtually) to share our progress with the entire time. Once or twice a year we meet for in-person meetings/trainings.

We make heavy use of Visual Studio Online for backlog and issue tracking. We love Open Source, but we don’t shy away from spending money to make sure we have the right tools for the job.  We aren’t afraid of trying new technology and make a point of regularly evaluating new tooling, libraries, and frameworks. 

Work schedules are flexible, but reasonable availability for meetings, collaboration, and customer support during core business hours is required.

Skills & Requirements

Our ideal candidate will exhibit:

  • proven experience developing large, rich JavaScript applications
  • demonstrable skills working with responsive design, HTML 5, and CSS
  • a solid command and understanding of C# and ASP.NET
  • the ability to work easily in a variety of programming languages and environments to support a variety of web, mobile, and desktop applications
  • an approach of always writing code as if they are the ones that will have to maintain it over the long haul (because who knows, maybe they will be…)
  • a serious interest in learning about and trying out new technologies and platforms

In addition, the following would be beneficial:

  • a working knowledge of SQL (ideally SQL Server)
  • experience developing JavaScript applications using TypeScript
  • experience working with cloud services, SQL Database, and BLOB storage in Microsoft Azure
  • professional-level written and verbal communications skills

If you have the experience and skills listed, we’d love to hear from you.

NO recruiters please.

About Us

AssureSign has been providing mission-critical electronic signature solutions to enterprise customers since 1999.  With over 180 million global signature events to-date, AssureSign is a clear leader in the market in both cloud and on-premise deployments.

We are headquartered in Atlanta, GA and are fortunate to call the Atlanta Tech Village our home.  We work in a mixed physical/virtual environment with some employees based out of our Atlanta office and others working from home.  We’ve worked hard over the past couple of years to completely virtualize our network and server infrastructure.  All of those services now reside in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

Our Technology Stack

Web Applications

On the server-side, our web applications typically leverage ASP.NET (C#) and SQL Server (typically Azure SQL Database).  With a service oriented architectural style, we rely on Nancy FX to develop our light-weight .NET-based HTTP services.

On the client-side, we make heavy use of JavaScript to create rich client-side experiences.  Most of our code is written in TypeScript using React and Redux.  We typically utilize a Gulp-based build system to generate our client-side code (CSS, JavaScript) from our source TypeScript and LESS files and to maximize our control over the build process.

Mobile Applications

We currently offer native mobile applications that work with our core SaaS product and specifically target: iOS, Android, and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

Desktop Applications

Our .NET based Windows desktop applications are designed to complement our core SaaS web application and make heavy use of the web-based API for our core application.

Why Work at AssureSign?

Our product: We’re customer centric and committed to continuous improvements to stand out from the competition.  The backlog never gets smaller, but the product continues to evolve and improve.

Our Team: We’re team players - We’re committed to the growth of our company and product and are supportive of one another.  We’re looking for a motivated developer to join us who thrives in a fast pace environment. 

We’re passionate about what we do, and have an ‘all hands on deck’ mentality when it comes to the success of our company and product.  We adapt, we find solutions, and are willing to question assumptions and think outside the box. We are looking for someone who shares those characteristics and is truly passionate about coding.

Benefits

In addition to competitive pay, AssureSign offers the following benefits:

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • Supplemental Insurance
  • 401k with company match and immediate full vesting
  • And an open vacation/time off policy: yes, you read that correctly

title: Full Stack Developer (C#/ React/SQL Server/Azure)

companyphilosophy:
You can do, become, achieve anything you want, the only thing that limits you is you. -Jeff Bender

Do you find yourself constantly revising your code to make it more efficient, reusable, and readable?

Do you believe that code is an art form, that simple solutions are the hardest to find but the most beautiful way of solving a problem?

Harris delivers its software solutions to over 18,000 customers across North America. With over 50 offices from coast to coast our more than 2,500 employees are located in almost every state and province.

Working for Harris is the perfect opportunity to fulfill your professional goals as well as achieve your personal goals and dreams! We are a financially strong, growing and stable company that offers employees the opportunity to learn and have fun! We empower our employees to make a difference and directly contribute to the success of the organization! 

Our employees enjoy a casual work environment that offers comfort while providing superior service to our customers. We offer a comprehensive benefit package as well as other additional “Perks”!

We are learning, We are growing, We are Harris!

 Harris Opportunities
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
We are seeking a dedicated professional for the full time position of a .Net Developer to create and enhance our school financial products. The successful candidate will be an integral part of the K12 Schools Development team. This position is ideal for those who are self-motivated, mentor other team members, willing to collaborate with other team members and take pride in delivering high quality results.

Primary Functions

  • Developing, and maintaining enhancements within deadlines
  • Release development methodology and change controls.
  • Ability to work independently and as a team player
  • Effectively collaborate with the Quality Assurance team to prevent and resolve defects.
  • Provide high level support for resolving production and customer support issues.
  • Communicate clearly, and enable collaboration with other departments / teams as required.
  • Be flexible, self-motivated and a team player.  
  • Knowledge with Agile Scrum Process is helpful but not required

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science, MIS or related field
  • 5+ years of development experience in .NET technologies including C# and VB.Net
  • 5+ years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server, including T-SQL
  • Knowledge of Crystal Reports is a plus
  • Experience building N-tiered software solutions and Windows Application Development
  • Ability to develop the code for new system features from Functional Specification documents
  • Ability to interact with customers and Support staff
  • Excellent written and verbal communications
  • Experience with Payroll/HR or other financial applications software is a plus

title: .NET Software Developer

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Mobile, Transportation, Private
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Do you have coding experience, but prefer people to code?

We are looking for lead support engineer who can provide excellent customer support to our diverse customer base.  We're bringing the transportation industry into the 21st century using mobile software. We're a small, distributed team that creates and runs SaaS products for trucking fleets and mobile workforces. As a startup, we live and breathe open source, http, Amazon web services, functional programming, etc. Our customers run our mobile products on iOS and Android and server-side they tend to work in Windows Server. Your challenge will be to bridge these worlds.

What we offer:

  • You'll be able to work from the comfort of your own home, or our office in Greenville, SC.
  • You will learn something almost every day. If you've ever wanted to read and touch Erlang or Clojure code, here's your chance!
  • You will work with a highly skilled team that cares about what we do and how we treat each other. We take our work seriously, and we have fun doing it.
  • Work/life balance is extremely important to us. We work to live, not live to work

What we're looking for:  

  • Above all, a helpful spirit.
  • Excellent and open communication skills.  We need you to talk to our mobile users who are truck drivers as well as well as our enterprise customers' business managers and IT staff.
  • A technical background: you can read code easily, maybe even write some, and you aren't afraid to dig into a code base to track down an issue.
  • SQL/relational database skill -- this skill enables you to analyze and solve problems.  We'll also ask you to create and modify reports on occasion.
  • Background in software development.  Your ability to do read and understand code will also help you to analyze problems and communicate with our team of developers.
  • Comfort with a command line -- rails console experience is a plus.
  • Firm grasp of web and mobile technology.
  • Experience with github and open source software.
  • Experience with trucking dispatch software and/or operations.

You will be the primary point of contact for all of our customers and we'll depend on you to provide a excellent support experience for each of them.  You will handle most support issues to full resolution; some you'll escalate to our development team while monitoring and following up as needed until resolved. As Customer Champion, you'll constantly look for ways to improve our support processes and tools as our company grows.

The kinds of support you'll provide will be many and varied: helping a truck driver reset a password, resolving billing questions and issues, brainstorming with a customer on creative ways to use our platform, bug tracking and QA for our mobile and web apps, helping our customers' developers troubleshoot their web services, creating robust custom reports using SQL, sales support for potential customers, spelunking through log files to track down a bug, updating and deploying configuration changes using Git and Heroku, writing and executing Ruby scripts, troubleshooting FTP issues, patiently explaining to a frustrated user how to change a setting on his iPhone, writing concise documentation, submitting and tracking bug reports and feature requests, and plenty more. 

The ideal candidate will find satisfaction in the interesting, technical tasks as well as the more routine or mundane ones, and provide excellent support tailored to the user's technical ability (or lack thereof). You're great at reading between the lines, seeing underlying issues and common threads between issues, and finding creative solutions and workarounds to unique problems. You're extremely comfortable working and communicating directly with developers technical teams. You're empathetic, patient, and you take ownership of issues in a way that instills confidence in customers.

title: Lead Support Engineer

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: DevOps, Network Virtualization, Telecommunications, Private
companyphilosophy:
What is Itential?

Itential is a rapidly growing software company focused on the next generation of Networking and OSS/Network Management applications. We are creating applications that are the future of networking leveraging SDN, NFV, and DevOps platforms and technologies.

We're helping customers deploy SDN & NFV technologies which are transforming networks creating new capabilities for real-time OSS & network management.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Itential is looking for senior software engineers to grow our core product development team. As a senior engineer, you will focus on developing all major releases of our Pronghorn application platform. The platform allows our customers and project teams to develop their own applications to solve specific problems within the telecommunications industry. You will use your JavaScript and full-stack development skills to implement new features, design new APIs and brokers, and continuously develop the product roadmap.

We expect our collaborative environment to challenge you with some of the hardest problems our customers are facing. You will work with a team of dedicated developers who are fully invested in making Pronghorn the market leader in our industry. Our Agile mindset is key to delivering the most value to our colleagues and clients, and strong opinions on how to improve our software development lifecycle are welcome. We are a diverse group that values innovative thinking, and we believe that a willingness to learn is our key to success.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Design and develop new features for the Pronghorn application platform
  • Act as a senior mentor for junior developers
  • Execute effective Agile processes and communicate cross-functionally
  • Track and own software quality metrics (defect rates, code/test coverage, etc.)
  • Promote Continuous Improvement/Continuous Development practices

This is a direct hire position. No third parties accepted. No S-corp or corp-to-corp.

Skills & Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience within the MEAN stack, with a focus on Node.js
  • Strong knowledge of services (mostly RESTful)
  • Experience working in Agile development environment focused on CI/CD
  • OSS, telecommunications, and networking experience a plus

title: Senior Engineer, Product Development

companyphilosophy:
Keysight Software Design Center

Keysight’s new Software Design Center in Midtown Atlanta will hire more than 200 software developers in rapid solution development, turning measurement science IP into killer apps, delivered into an always-on, everywhere-available app store ecosystem.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
We are seeking a tech lead with passion for software innovation, robustness, and elegance. Projects including data management, data analytics, cross-OS platform, data visualization, data streaming, embedded systems and cloud computing.

You will explore and champion new technologies, applications and software practices. You will lead changes within the team and across the organization. 

  • Competitive Pay and Benefits
  • Fun Work Environment
  • Free Daily Lunch
  • Interesting Products: By Engineers For Engineers

Skills & Requirements

Ideally your skill set will align with the following:

  •  Bachelor degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent field.
  •  Graduate degree is an advantage
  •  Five years or more of experience in software engineering work. The length of working experience is less important than your ability to demonstrate advanced software coding skills, a solid grasp of software architecture and evidences of sophisticated results produced.
  •  Well-versed in modern techniques in object-oriented design, design patterns, and C++ 11 standards
  •  Passionate about intuitive use model and working knowledge of GUI development
  •  Experience with javascript or other scripting language communicating with back-end server component. 
  •  Solid experience with software development toolset (IDE, graphical and numerical libraries, performance and memory usage profilers, etc.)
  •  Leadership skills to work effectively within a team with positive influence over the team Being versatile, a quick learner and a critical thinker


Desired knowledge and experience:

  •  Windows and Linux platforms
  •  Modern software development process that has quality and testability designed in
  •  Programming for mobile devices or web browser
  •  Multi-threaded programming
  •  Integrating C++ backend with asynchronous javascript user interface
  •  Python, Matlab, HTML, OpenGL, WebGL

title: Lead Software Engineer, Frontend/Backend Integration

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Health Care, Public
companyphilosophy:
Great Developers, Great Applications

Rich user experiences utilizing current technology stacks which produce applications that users actually enjoy and want to use while providing tremendous value to our company.

That is what the SCA Application Development team is all about. We are constantly driving to this goal guided by a philosophy and set of principles that are both powerful and straightforward. We are a team that is passionate about great development AND great developers. We want only the best on our team, and we get the best because of our great environment, top notch tool sets, and great momentum all while ensuring that developers get to focus on what they love to do - develop. We are a team of great developers, striving to be the best development team in the healthcare industry.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Join our team in revolutionizing the way technology is used within surgery centers across the country. We are looking for smart, passionate individuals who love digging into and solving complex problems. Our team creates and maintains web based enterprise applications utilizing the most up to date front end technologies supported by a robust back end stack. As a database administrator, you'll get to work alongside our application and BI development teams in supporting and maintaining the over 250 database instances on which these applications depend.

We have a full time position available in our Birmingham, AL office location (no relocation allowance currently offered). As a Database Administrator you will be responsible for:

  • Assisting the DBA team to ensure the availability and performance of all supported SQL Server databases including deployments, administration, maintenance, performance tuning and monitoring
  • Providing day-to-day database support and maintenance
  • Preparing and maintaining up-to-date documentation as required
  • Helping to facilitate the resolution of support/maintenance issues to meet customer expectations
  • Documenting, and adhering to standard procedures and best practices
  • On-Call requirements to ensure 24x7 support of database operations
  • Following Change Management processes for all database related changes
  • Adhering to industry standard regulations including HIPAA and SOX

Skills & requirements

We believe there is a staggering difference between the 90th percentile and the 99th percentile.

We are highly selective when it comes to adding people to our team, and our team members play an active role in this process. When we do find the next member of our team, we move quickly to bring them on board.

Members of our team generally have the following characteristics

  • Enjoy working with others and others enjoy working with them
  • Highly sought after (regularly recruited) And in our case, they usually stay
  • Well compensated
  • Constantly improving their own skills as well as the skills of those on their team
  • Gravitate toward the tough problems because everything else is too boring

A successful DBA on our team will possess the following technical skill sets.

  • 3+ years’ experience with database administration in a SQL Server environment
  • Experience administering SQL Server 2008 R2 and SQL 2012
  • Experience with SQL 2014 or higher a plus
  • Understanding of performance monitoring tools
  • Understanding of index and query optimization
  • Experience with SSRS, SSAS, SSIS is a plus
  • Knowledge of SQL Server architecture, such as objects, schemas, system database, SQL Services and SQL Agent
  • Knowledge of SQL Server backup/restore and other maintenance strategies
  • Ability to troubleshoot and solve SQL Server performance issues
  • Experience writing SQL statements
  • Ability to manage a variety of tasks effectively
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Education Technology, Technical Services, Web Technology, Private
companyphilosophy:
We are a very close team

Technical proficiency is important, but working well within the team is more so.  Team members can rely on each to get things done and to be open and  honest with one-another.  

We follow SCRUM methodology and are a continuous deployment shop. 

Currently, we work on 2 week sprints, hold daily stand-ups at 8:30am CST, conduct sprint planning, reviews and retros.

Once a task is assigned or chosen, it would be worked, pass automated tests, pass 2 peer reviews and then merged into master.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Basic Purpose: The Technical Project Managers core responsibility is to comprehend, communicate and articulate technical specifications, expectations and requirements to project parties, establish an approved project timeline and ensure project deliverables are on time.

Organizational scope: The Technical Project Manager is an essential role to the organization as this person is directly responsible for overseeing a project’s adherence and execution to the approved project timeline. A technical background, strong communication and detail oriented organization skill is essential to the success of the role.

Essential functions:

  1. Communicate, Comprehend and Articulate project requirements (40%)
    • Closely communicate with all parties to understand and anticipate needs and project requirements
    • Comprehend and confirm project requirements
    • Present project requirements and tasks to appropriate parties
    • Seek clarification on requirements from stakeholders where applicable
  2. Creation of Project Timelines (30%)
    • Create project milestones
    • Separate each milestone into tasks and subtasks
    • Establish estimated completion time for each milestone
    • Establish estimated completion time for the project
    • Prepare references and documentation
  3. Ensuring Project Task Execution (10%)
    • Constant and methodical communication to task owners and stake holders
    • Understanding and articulating task owner responses
    • Documenting results in a project tracking software
  4. Provide Timely Project Reports and Updates (10%)
    • Be prepared to report to stake holders and product owners on project status
    • Proactively communicate potential roadblocks
    • Prepare project and task retrospectives
  5. Maintain professional and technical knowledge (5%)
    • Attend educational workshops
    • Reviewing professional publications
    • Establishing personal networks

Non-essential functions:  (5%)

  1. Perform other duties, special projects and other responsibilities as assigned by ProctorU leadership.
  • Maintain good working relationships and open lines of communication with all other departments.
  • Ensure a safe, pleasant and comfortable work environment for all test takers and employees

title: Software Development Project Manager

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Software Development, Founded 2000
companyphilosophy:
Come Build Some Awesome with Us!

We made the Best Companies to Work for in Florida list again! Thank you to our awesome team!

We are driven by people who have a passion for technology and innovation. We are a company filled with talent in Infrastructure, Creative/Web Development and Software Development building quality, forward thinking applications and websites for clients across the globe.

Our culture has helped us grow quick enough to make Inc. Magazine’s list of the fastest growing companies in America two years (2009, 2010) in a row and Florida Trend Magazine's Best Companies to Work for seven years in a row from 2010-2016. You will work in a very cool office with the latest technologies, the best equipment, and awesome people who helped us become one of the best companies to work for in Florida.

We have locations in Austin, TX, Atlanta, GA and Memphis, TN. Currently we are seeking to fill a Lead Software Engineer position which is onsite in our new, state of the art office in beautiful Fort Walton Beach, FL.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Do you view problems as opportunities and feel pride with the completion of a task “owned” from start to finish? 

As a Bit-Wizards’ Software Engineer you will work with other engineers of the highest caliber to engineer exciting, effective solutions for each client. If you can build and manage relationships with customers and co-workers, focus on the details of every task, as well as explore and master new technologies while having fun, you will fit in well at Bit-Wizards!

This position is full-time and in-house at our office in beautiful Fort Walton Beach, Florida. Applicants must be able to work with our team in our headquarters office in Florida.

Responsibilities:                                        

  • Interface with clients to determine business requirements as well as gain their trust and keep in constant contact with clients on the progress of ongoing projects.
  • Work well in a team environment to assist and seek assistance from peers in order to complete projects efficiently.
  • Design, develop, and launch highly-visible, feature rich applications.
  • Support existing business applications for clients.
  • Troubleshoot to define issues, and resolving them along with your team.
  • Be a team player who takes ownership of projects and drives them through to completion thoroughly and efficiently.

Requirements:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical studies.       
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in ASP.NET development, C# and JavaScript.
  • Experience with SQL based Database including Database design.
  • Extensive knowledge of Windows operating systems.
  • Strong problem solving skills, adaptable, proactive and proven ownership thinking/mentality.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple areas of responsibilities.
  • Proactive, customer-focused with a passion for Web and emerging technologies.

Bonus Points if you have This Expertise:

Microsoft Developer Certification(s), experience with Kentico or other Content Management Systems, Microsoft Azure, Mobile Development/Mobile Apps, HTML 5, TFS, MS Test Manager, JQuery, SQL Reporting Services, Dynamics, QuickBooks SDK, WCF, XAML, MVC, Object Oriented Programming, Agile Development, T-SQL and other tools and development platforms that run on the Microsoft family of operating systems.

Benefits of Wizard Life:

  • Competitive salary
  • Quarterly performance reviews
  • Personal time off – starting with 3 weeks, up to 5 weeks!
  • Paid holidays (12 annually)
  • Flex-Time
  • Employee medical insurance
  • Family medical insurance
  • Long term disability and life insurance
  • Dental checkups (twice per year): 100% paid, Dental Insurance available
  • 401k Available
  • Certification-based pay raises
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Technical book reimbursement program
  • Snacks, sodas, coffee, hot and cold teas, hot chocolate, (yes, we have a Keurig) orange juice, filtered water
  • Annual summer picnic
  • Annual awards dinner
  • Monthly team building activities (bowling, kickball, cooking competitions, beer 30’s, etcetera)
  • A team of fun, energizing and inspiring Co-Wizards to keep our workplace happy and fun! (our Employees are Wizards, of course!)

title: Lead Software Engineer

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Product Development, Private
companyphilosophy:
Why it’s awesome to work at Configit

We help big companies solve very difficult problems. We have the tools, know-how and integrity to help our customers transform how they work.

Configit is an independent software vendor that offers third generation configuration solutions to companies with product configuration needs. The configurators are used for exploring the variance in product development, for sales configurations, and for maintenance, services and overhaul of complex products.

Configit’s core technology is based on research in formal verification and constraint solving. All Configit products are based on the patented Virtual Tabulation technology.

Configit customers include ABB, Jaguar Land Rover, John Deere, Grundfos, Vestas, Siemens, Danfoss amongst others.

We are an Agile organisation, adhering to the principles of Agile and promoting the methodology within our customer base.

The company is very international in nature which reflects our customer base. Our headquarter is a modern and charismatic environment both near water and near the centre of Copenhagen but our offices in Warwick (UK), Langenfeld (DE), Atlanta, Georgia (US) and Chennai (IN) continue to expand.

The Configit culture is relaxed with an emphasis on mutual respect and trust.

And more importantly:

  • We work with complex and challenging products which redefine what companies are capable of  
  • We believe in a healthy work-life balance, a trademark of the Danish culture  
  • We work closely together across all disciplines  
  • We believe in knowledge sharing and provide funding for your continued learning  
  • We socialize together, with board games, film nights and more  
  • We are passionate about what we do and work closely together across all disciplines  
  • We cherish an informal and open culture where the customers are in focus 

Follow Us
Follow us on Twitter, YouTube and LinkedIn.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Configit is looking for a talented developer to join our Delivery team in Atlanta for creating customer specific software solutions based on Configit’s suite of products.
Your task is to create the best value and solutions for our customers using Configit standard products; develop plugins and extensions to the Configit Quote® user interface; and do backend integrations towards standard- and customer-specific systems. Tasks also include the development of standard web based or desktop based standalone configurators and rule engines.
You work closely with our clients to learn about their configurable products and understand their business requirements and processes, and will be in close collaboration with both your closest colleagues working on Delivery projects and with developers working on product development. We are C# and JavaScript developers by heart but are not afraid of an occasional API integration done in Java if needed.
You will be involved in all phases of client deliveries to ensure the best implementation possible to every one of our clients, including requirements gathering and evaluation; design decisions and estimations; sprint planning, drops and demos; development and implementation; deployments; integration and regression testing; and post go-live support.

Your responsibilities  
  • Work with clients to understand their products and processes  
  • Collect and structure client product data such as bills of materials, drawings, rules, pricing, and documents 
  • Develop modern web applications using Configit products, adding plugins and extensions hereto 
  • Implementing configure, price, and quote (CPQ) software solutions interacting with SAP – the world’s largest enterprise software platform  
  • Develop architecturally extensible and maintainable solutions  
  • Design and develop intuitive user interfaces  
  • Use client feedback to help drive and further evolve our product development  

Depending on the project you will be working on, you will get to work in a variety of technologies. C#, Javascript, AngularJs, HTML, .NET, MVC, and RESTful web services and SQL. Additionally, we use tools like git, GitHub, TeamCity and JIRA for product and solution development

What you bring 

  • Min. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Configuration, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or similar  
  • Experience as a software developer or engineer within complex software solutions 
  • Experience as a product expert within a complex product area (is an advantage) 
  • Skills within one or more of the above mentioned technologies (especially .NET, C#, and JavaScript) 
  • Desire to stay current with technology and best practices 
  • A pragmatic approach 
  • Ability to manage multiple on-going activities

What we offer 
A unique opportunity in a dynamic, ambitious and international environment where;  

  • Medical benefits 
  • 401k 
  • A Scandinavian touch, with free lunches and plenty of coffee 
  • Professional growth through an international organization with many career opportunities 
  • A healthy work-life balance, a trademark of the Danish culture 
  • Close collaboration across all disciplines in a team culture 
  • Complex and challenging products which redefine what companies are capable of

title: Senior Software Engineer at Danish configuration software vendor in Atlanta, GA

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: eCommerce, Media, Software Consulting, Private
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Outstanding DevOps Engineer Opportunity

3 days on site with 2 remote/wfh days per week


Analyze, design, implement and validate all aspects of the application delivery pipeline. Establish best practices and drive automation methodologies for continuous integration and delivery. Aid in implementing and managing application health (performance, stability, scalability, etc.) and support security and audit related activities. Evaluate and make recommendations for various software packages and upgrades needed to establish a DevOps toolchain within the organization.

Manage and execute automated builds against source control repository for various environments (Dev, QA, Staging, Production) given established branching strategy. Collaborate with developers in identifying and creating the appropriate branches that meet the need of application initiatives and roadmaps. Aid with merging of application code. Help manage test cases and initiate automated unit and integration testing. Identify and implement automated load testing. Assume responsibility for producing deployment artifacts and packages for all environments from the established automated builds. Establish sound automated deployment processes to the various environments which adhere to the established IT policies and change control process. Deployment may include moving files, running SQL scripts, configuration changes, third-party installation and any other activity that is required for application deployment. Collaborate with the implementation and configuration of performance monitoring and synthetic testing. Aid with analyzing and interpreting monitoring results and help recommend paths to increased performance.

Work closely with senior management both within IT and outside of IT to communicate effectively in non-technical terms. Create and maintain positive and professional relationships with the user community and third party vendors. Drive technical projects to successful completion from start to finish without supervision. 

Support peers and be a mentor to less experienced resources. Possess an intellectual curiosity about new technologies and functions as a change agent. Must be self-motivated advancing skills in new scripting languages, databases, development tools or development techniques quickly and completely. Provide recommendations to management on ways to use new technologies or improve existing application architecture that results in improved application deliverability and health.

Specific Job Knowledge

  • Practical working knowledge of networking, security, virtualized and cloud based infrastructure
  • Ability to identify and understand various enterprise and application architectures
  • Highly knowledgeable with networking concepts (DNS, ACLs, HTTPS, Load Balancing, Firewalls)
  • Knowledge of development, test and production environments and configuration processes
  • Ability to demonstrate effective written and verbal communication skills in both technical and non-technical terms.
  • Good analytical, diagnostic and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to foster a positive work environment by promoting teamwork and open communication.
  • With management guidance, be able to prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining deadlines.




DevOps Specifics

  • OS: Windows, Linux
  • Databases:  Oracle, SQL Server, Mongo, RavenDB (or similar RDBMS/No SQL), Redgate, Data Virtualization
  • Languages:  PowerShell, C#, Ruby, Perl, Python, T-SQL, SQLCMD
  • Build Management/Automation:  TeamCity, Jenkins (or similar), Chef, Puppet, Ansible
  • Other Tools/Technologies: Vagrant and VMWare
  • Source Control:  TFS, Git, Subversion (or similar)
  • Performance Monitoring:  Dynatrace, New Relic, AppDynamics (or similar)
  • Application Tools:  MSBuild, Visual Studio, IIS, SQL Server Management Studio, Quartz, Windows Scheduler

Relocation assistance is not provided to non-local candidates – Visa sponsorship is not available

Please contact Javier Vivanco at 404-809-1898 or send resume to javi@talentandacquisition.com

title: DevOps Engineer 2 days remote LONG TERM CONTRACT
company: Talent & Acquisition, LLC  - Sandy Springs, GA

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Cybersecurity, Private
companyphilosophy:
End-to-end Security Solutions Provider

Zyston is an information security solutions company providing businesses the comprehensive range of end-to-end services required to build and operate mature, cost-effective information security programs. Zyston's flagship product - InfoSec Program as a Service (IPaaS) - provides the full-service capabilities required to manage complete oversight of an organization's information security program. This allows companies to developer and operationalize custom-tailored programs built specifically to address their organization's needs and challenges depending on where they are in the development of their security program. Zyston's full range of offering includes: 

  • Advising and consulting services essential to the design and development of strategic, sustainable information security programs
  • Talent acquisition and staff augmentation services that enable companies to source dedicated, industry-leading security experts and ensure the right team is in place
  • Managed security services capabilities designed to significantly and rapidly improve an organization's situational awareness and security posture
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Full-Stack Developer


We’re currently looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to join the team in Alpharetta, Ga. The Software Engineer is responsible for the design, development, testing, and maintenance of J2EE web applications leveraging AngularJS and SpringMVC, as well as SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) based web services working with technologies such as REST, SOAP, Groovy, MongoDB, and Apache Solr/Lucene.

We are looking for:

  • A passionate technologist with a thirst for knowledge
  • A self-starter who wants to look under the covers and understand how and why things work
  • A person well versed in the fundamentals of OOA/OOD
  • A great collaborator who is excited to be part of a high-functioning team
  • An advocate of clean, well-tested code

You will be responsible for:

  • Designing, implementing, and maintaining applications that are used by thousands of people every day
  • Assisting with partner and client technical teams to turn business requirements to technical specifications
  • Re-factoring and improving the existing code base

You will learn:

  • Full lifecycle software delivery from concept to production
  • How to write enterprise software at scale using techniques such as SOA and TDD
  • Agile development methodologies and modern Continuous Integration techniques
  • To operate in a fast-paced and exciting workplace that is constantly solving new problems

You should have:

  • Professional or academic experience with Java or other JVM languages
  • A very strong understanding of Object Oriented Analysis and Design
  • Knowledge of unit testing principles and best practices
  • Exceptional communication skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently
  • BSCS/BSEE or comparable equivalent

title: Full-Stack Developer

companyphilosophy:
Collaborative scrum teams solving healthcare workforce challenges

Our developers solve challenging problems ranging from automating complex physician schedules to developing optimized user interfaces for visualizing schedules.  We value collaborative architecture discussions, continuous integration, and ensuring quality through unit and functional testing.  We actively look for ways to refactor our code and allocate 20% of our capacity each sprint toward those efforts.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription: In your role as a Senior Software Engineer you will work with others to design, develop, and implement any changes, bug fixes, and new features to our web application QGenda.com.  We're looking for engineers who thrive in short iteration scrum environments.  Our scrum team works in one week sprints and has a strong track record of meeting sprint commitments.  We value collaborative architecture discussions, continuous integration, and ensuring quality through unit and functional testing.  Our engineers solve challenging problems ranging from automating complex schedules to developing optimized user interfaces for visualizing schedules.  We actively look for ways to refactor our code and allocate 20% of our capacity each sprint toward those efforts.  If tackling these kinds of challenges sounds interesting, we'd love to talk to you!

companyphilosophy: We’re publicly traded (TREE), we’re financially sound and we’re on a tear. If you’re looking for an opportunity with a dynamic company that is fanatically pro-consumer and that champions your entrepreneurial spirit, then you’ve come to the right place!
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Is the list of technologies you’ve put your hands on a mile long?  Do you love to work on the latest and greatest stuff like Docker, Redis, Spark, Kubernetes, you name it, and build new from the ground up?    

LendingTree is searching for the next dev ops rock star to help rock our automation world and be a part of the team that builds the next generation of our deployment and infrastructure provisioning platform.  If when you hear about a new system, you’re insatiable curious and you’ve got the systems chops to get it up and running (in dev we hope) in a flash, then this is the role for you.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Build and extend the automation tools for infrastructure provisioning, dynamic scaling, test automation and code deployments across all environments.
  • Working closely with engineering, refine and improve the release management framework to support an always-on, 24x7 environment. Money never sleeps, neither should our infrastructure.
  • Provision and manage platform level services such as logging infrastructure.
  • Help troubleshoot issues at any level of the stack, from the OS up to the app.
  • Continually drive better metrics and monitoring initiatives to ensure alerts fire when needed and the system stays up despite the unexpected.

title: DevOps Engineer

Are you who we are looking for?

Do you have extensive experience delivering SaaS solutions on the .NET stack? Are you a strong advocate of unit testing? Have you built multiple REST APIs in ASP.NET MVC? Do you believe the best architects are coding members of the team? Are you a lifelong learner who loves to share your knowledge and level up the whole team by pairing programming?

What you’ll bring:

  • Expert level knowledge of C# and all flavors of ASP.NET
  • Deep experience with unit testing and TDD
  • Deep experience with SQL Server
  • Some experience with TypeScript and Angular
  • Mastery of OO design patterns and SOLID principles

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts and designs effectively

It would be great if would also bring:

  • Experience with NHibernate
  • Experience with TeamCity and Octopus Deploy
  • Experience with AWS Lambda and Serverless

What you’ll do:

  • Be a lead developer on our core platform team
  • Help us continue to innovate and delight the users who run their associations on our software
  • Level up the team through extensive pairing

Engineering-centric

Engineering is a key part to our ability to deliver solutions and engineers play a key role in both designing and validating solutions with our customers.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Clockwise.MD is currently hiring for a Software Engineer to support our rapidly growing client base. We are looking for candidates who like to problem-solve and work as a team player. Must have excellent analytical, interpersonal, and technical abilities. Engineering is a key part to our ability to deliver solutions and engineers play a key role in both designing and validating solutions with our customers. Clockwise.MD views itself as Engineering-centric.

We work in Ruby, JavaScript, SQL, CSS and HTML. We use Rails, Vue.js and Node.js with PostgreSQL, Redis and Memcached. Our CI/CD process is completely automated and we release at least once daily using a single simple command. You’ll work as a trusted peer on a small team to implement solutions to real problems. We all work on each layer in the stack, we support each other and we learn from each other.

We are looking for a talented software engineer committed to his or her craft to become a key member of our small growing team.

environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
1st Edge is seeking skilled developers to assess firmware and software as part of an ongoing effort supporting our government customer. Assessment includes: decomposing existing source code using requirements, design and test documents, writing test and data capture frameworks to fully exercise the code under test, and recommending fixes and improvements to the code. Unlike traditional IV&V,  the assessment teams write code. Candidates will work in an Agile, multi-contractor, Software-In-The-Loop (SWIL) environment directly with the government customer. Candidates will be responsible for providing input into all aspects of assessment in addition to supporting SWIL activities. 

Required Qualifications 

    BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Science  2-15 years of applicable experience  Embedded development experience  Must be able to obtain a Secret level clearance 

Desired Qualifications 

    Masters degree in CPE, CS or EE  Experience in C++  Experience developing Xilinx FPGAs  Experience with Fortran  Experience developing VHDL  Experience with Questasim  Experience with BlueSpec  Experience using Simulink  Experience as an V&V team member  Experience developing in a Linux environment 

Must be a U.S. citizen.

environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Creative Radicals is seeking a full-time System & Network Engineer to join our team in our Tampa, FL office.  This position will work directly with the engineering and implementation teams to manage both our internal systems and customer deployments.  Our ideal candidate will have a supportive, team-oriented mindset and will take the lead to ensure our IT systems are highly-available and secure.  We are a small company, growing quickly, and are looking for people who enjoy working as a member of a fast-paced, agile team. MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN. NO REMOTE WORK FOR THIS POSITION.

Responsibilities

  • Deployment and management of servers on internal and customer networks
  • Design, build, and deployment of high-availability hosting strategy
  • Management of internal company networks and systems, including LANs, WLANs, VOIP systems, testing and training networks
  • Installation, configuration, administration, and support of company software products across numerous customer deployments
  • Configuration, monitoring, maintenance, and support of various network and server security systems
  • Management of internal company systems including Microsoft Exchange Server and Microsoft Active Directory
  • Create and maintain processes, scripts, and computer programs to support systems
  • Work closely with our engineering and implementation teams to support design, development, field testing, exercises, and production deployments of our products
  • Additional IT responsibilities as required

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Digital Media, Media, Publishing, Public
companyphilosophy:
About Time Inc.

Time Inc. (NYSE:TIME) is a leading multi-platform consumer media company that engages over 170 million consumers globally every month. The company's influential brands include PEOPLE, TIME, FORTUNE, SPORTS ILLUSTRATED, INSTYLE, REAL SIMPLE, SOUTHERN LIVING and TRAVEL + LEISURE, as well as approximately 60 diverse international brands. Time Inc. offers marketers a differentiated proposition in the marketplace by combining its powerful brands, trusted content, audience scale, direct relationships with consumers and unique first-party data. The company is home to growing media and platforms, including digital video, OTT, television, licensing, paid products and services and celebrated live events, such as the TIME 100, FORTUNE Most Powerful Women, PEOPLE’s Sexiest Man Alive, SPORTS ILLUSTRATED’s Sportsperson of the Year, the ESSENCE Festival and the FOOD & WINE Classic in Aspen.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
As Time Inc. continues to invest in streamlining their business and improving our software practices and efficiencies across all of our brands, we are seeking a capable and talented Sr. Software Engineer to help define and build Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform. This individual will participate in the ideation of and delivery of key aspects of our new architecture ranging from data ingestion, consumer behavioral insights, machine learning, data governance and customer privacy. The scope of this role is all aspects of data management for Time Inc. and its brands.

This role will involve software development of key data platform modules for Time Inc.'s next-generation data platform ecosystem. Responsibilities for engineering will span all aspects of data, including but not limited to: data ingestion, governance, machine learning, analytics and insights and personalization systems. You will contribute to the ecosystem's design and architecture, and be responsible for detailed design of full vertical modules within the data platform. This role involves both coaching/mentoring of other engineers as well as significant hands-on engineering. Strong test-driven development skills and incremental and rapid iteration in your development ethic is critical for this fast-moving and key initiative for Time Inc. Proven track-record of developing large-scale systems using service-oriented architecture and cloud technologies is a must as that will be part of your routine role. Our efforts will include both individual system development as well as assessment and integration of third-party software products. Knowledge and experience utilizing standardized APIs and specifications are preferred.  Knowledge in the data space around data management, ingestion, and learning is a must. Experience with data related cloud technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Kinesis, Lambda, RDS, Aurora, EMR are strongly desired as well as experience with data science technologies such as neo4j and R.

Experience and Requirements

  • Master's Degree in Computer Science or related field with 1+ year relevant experience; or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field with 5+ years relevant experience
  • Demonstrated proficiency with Java, C++, or equivalent object-oriented programming language; or demonstrated ability to quickly learn new programming languages and tools
  • Experience working in Python, NodeJS or similar Lambda-supported languages
  • Object-oriented analysis and design skills
  • Problem solving and analytical abilities
  • Understanding of algorithmic design and complexity analysis
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and an ability to work in a team environment
  • Experience building high-performance, highly-available, and scalable distributed systems
  • Proven ability to identify and mitigate the root cause of issues
  • Demonstrated skill and passion for operational excellence
  • Experience collecting software product requirements, describing software product features, and creating technical designs
  • Experience with cloud-based technologies and Software-as-a-Service (Saas) systems such as Amazon AWS.
  • Experience with service-oriented architectures

Ideal Additional Qualifications

  • Experience with AWS Kinesis, Data Migration Service, Data Pipeline, SQS and other data movement technologies is a plus.
  • Experience with Oozie, Sqoop, Flume, Falcon, Kafka, Storm, Spark and/or other Hadoop Ecosystem components are a plus.
  • Experience in ETL/ELT workflow management is a plus.
  • Experience with Big Data database components such as Hive, AWS Redshift, and/or AWS DynamoDB is a plus.

environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
We are looking for a full time (on-site) .NET/C# developer (any skill-set, matching salary) with the desire to learn new technologies and solve problems in our downtown Bradenton office. You will be a part of R&D and will get hands on experience with the latest technologies in the market!

The successful candidate will work on a wide-array of systems using a common infrastructure.

Skills & Requirements

  • Associates/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or 2+ years of on-the-job experience
  • Excellent C#/.NET skills
  • Writing unit tests (TDD)
  • WPF/Xaml with Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)
  • Object-Oriented-Design
  • Database development and design
  • Source control using GIT
  • A design to learn and keep learning!

Additional Useful Skills

  • DirectShow (for video recording and display)
  • Mobile applications (Xamarin C#/.NET, Objective-C, Java)
  • MongoDB
  • HTTP REST/API design and development

title: C# Developer

companyphilosophy:
A new Fintech company, small and growing quickly

We're building a whole new core banking system from the ground up. Our team is small and distributed. We're looking to grow in the Jacksonville Florida and in the Palo Alto California areas. 

Read about us on American Banker:

https://www.americanbanker.com/news/why-veteran-of-a-legacy-vendor-joined-core-banking-startup-crowd

As you can see we just launched the company on May 9th, so we do not have office space at either location. We'll take care of that soon. For Jacksonville we have a location in mind. In Palo Alto, we're looking to build the team first and then select a location that best fits the team.

environmentTemplateJSON.companycustomers: Your target industry customers are: Manufacturing, Software Development, Public
companyphilosophy:
Our vision is to be the best provider of building products in the eyes of our customers, employees, shareholders, suppliers and communities.

At Masonite, we understand that people are key.  We are a composite of diverse people who come together by showing support and respect to one another.

We hire people that demonstrate integrity under pressure. Integrity is at the foundation of everything we do.  It is in each door we make, in our commitment delivery and in our honest and sincere communication.

Our employees are flexible, versatile and resilient. Our ability to weather any storm, to bend without breaking, is what allows us to hear the knock and open the door with confidence, no matter what’s on the other side.

At Masonite, we hold the door open for each other and for new ideas. We want everyone to freely contribute ideas and add value, so we are positive and encouraging.  This collaborative environment is what makes Masonite a transparent, fair company- one that doesn’t hide behind closed doors.

We continuously strive to improve both our products and our customers’ experiences. This drive leads us to revolutionize the door industry and help people walk through walls.
environmentTemplateJSON.companydescription:
Masonite is looking for a Senior WordPress Developer with cutting-edge experience developing websites to provide an unparalleled digital experience to join the team. Developer will leverage innovative technologies such as PHP, Bootstrap, JavaScript, React, WordPress, HTML5, CSS3 to develop mobile responsive websites and applications in an agile environment.

  • Collaborate with the product owner to articulate the best technological business solution
  • Analyze user story acceptance criteria to ensure the technical feasibility and point out potential issues
  • Work with a team of developers to deliver on time and scope. 
  • Architect and develop broadly compatible products, features, and bug fixes with consideration for accessibility, performance, and multilingual installations 
  • Write high quality code with readability, efficiency and maintainability in mind (documentation and unit tests).
  • Develop and maintain complex WordPress-based applications
  • Implement complex features using modern PHP code and patterns while following standards
  • Develop WordPress widgets, Plug-ins, Custom post types, and page templates. 
  • Code review the work of other developers
  • Improve internal tools, libraries, standards, and Continuous Integration. 
  • Actively participate in our scrum meetings 
  • work with the team to diagnose and resolve bugs and support requests.  
  • Implementation of restful services for product selector
  • Mentor junior developers

Qualifications

  • Eight (8) plus years of experience developing web-based applications
  • Five (5) plus years of experience developing WordPress Sites
  • Extensive experience implementing complex WordPress multisites 
  • Expertise in crafting modern PHP
  • Comprehensive understanding of what it takes to write secure and performant code
  • Thorough knowledge of WordPress, PHP, MySQL, Bootstrap, JavaScript (ES6), React, HTML5, Sass, and CSS3.
  • Proven expertise of Object Oriented Principals, software development life cycle, and best practices. 
  • Experience working with automated testing frameworks. 
  • Experience with continuous integration and automated deployment pipelines
  • Unit testing experience
  • Understanding of RESTful Web Services technologies such as JSON, SOAP, and HTTP
  • Experience using GIT software 
  • Ability to work in our Ybor office 
  • Agile Development experience

title: Senior WordPress/PHP Developer
